subject: Management
title: The 70% Failure Rate
description: A quick win: understand The 70% Failure Rate.

hook.text: McKinsey found that 70% of organizational change efforts fail. Seven out of ten. Every time.

buildup.text: Companies spend billions on change programs. Most of that money is wasted.

discovery.text: The top reasons: no urgency, no coalition, no vision, no communication, no quick wins.

twist.text: Change doesn't fail because of bad strategy. It fails because of bad execution and ignored people.

climax.text: Study why change fails before attempting it. The failure patterns are predictable and avoidable.

punchline.text: Most change fails the same way. Learn the pattern. Break it.

quiz.question: What percentage of organizational change efforts fail?
options: Less than 20% of well-planned change efforts
Nearly 100% because all change is impossible
